Why he should add Paul, and why Paul alone, I do not know. And with his usual drowsiness he returns again to eternal penaltieS, as though he had not said that before. Now if these threats and curses were Con- stantine'S, I in turn would curse him as a tyrant and destroyer of my country, and would threaten that Ι, as a Roman, would take vengeance on him. But who would be afraid of the curse of an overly avaricious man, and one saying a counterfeit speech after the manner of actorS, and terrifying people in the role of Constantine? This is being a hypocrite in the true sense, if we press the Greek word closely; that is, hiding your own personality under another's.
